pose: The thumb cooperates with the other three fingers to wrap around a long, thin cylinder; the pinky is suspended or touches lightly.
features: Medium-to-high finger flexion angle; finger pads conform to the cylinder surface; thumb opposes the index/middle fingers to create stable clamping.
usage: Grasping test tubes, thin handles, or small bottles with small diameters requiring stable torque.

pose: Multiple fingers are adducted (close together), and the thumb presses against the finger array from the outside to form a clamp.
features: Small inter-finger spacing; finger array forms a planar surface; thumb applies lateral pressure for torque resistance.
usage: Lateral clamping and transporting of thin, flat, or edge-like objects.

pose: Fingers arc upward to support; thumb forms a shallow opposing arc.
features: Fingers are distributed evenly in an arch; palm maintains a certain opening; thumb provides anti-slip opposing force.
usage: Supporting/Lifting upward-opening bowls, cups, or shallow containers.

pose: Multiple fingers flex to wrap around the box's side walls; thumb presses the opposite side to enclose it.
features: Medium-to-high finger flexion; large contact area between finger pads and the plane; thumb opposes index/middle fingers.
usage: Grasping and transporting medium-to-small sized prisms or packaging boxes.

pose: Thumb opposes the other fingers to encircle a curved handle, forming a closed loop.
features: Proximal phalanges flexed; distal phalanges fit moderately; forms force closure to prevent slipping.
usage: Grasping water canteens or jugs with handles for lifting or pouring.

pose: Thumb pad pinches against the distal pads of the index/middle fingers; other fingers retracted.
features: Controllable distal flexion; small contact area at fingertips; precise relative positioning.
usage: Picking up or adjusting small precision parts (screws, tiny electronic components).

pose: Palm and fingers extended flat; fingertips slightly flexed to press widely on the target plane.
features: Fingers spread out; contact creates large-area pressure; thumb abduction aids stability.
usage: Pressing or covering large planar targets (button panels, covers).

pose: Five fingers maximally abducted and extended; palm completely open.
features: Large inter-finger angles; small flexion angles; preparatory pose before contact.
usage: Initial open pose for scanning, approaching, or enveloping.

pose: Multiple fingers flex significantly to embrace a thick cylinder; thumb opposes the other fingers.
features: High proximal flexion; multi-point contact on the curved surface; forms a resultant force ring.
usage: Grasping bottles, cans, thick rods, or large cylinders for transport or stabilization.

pose: Thumb and 3-4 fingers flex and converge uniformly to wrap a small sphere.
features: Small fingertip spacing; multi-sided contact; light squeezing to prevent slipping.
usage: Holding small balls, round fruits, or spherical parts.

pose: Five fingers flex into an arc surface distributed evenly around a medium sphere; space left in the palm.
features: Moderate finger flexion; balanced fingertip positions; resists multi-directional slip.
usage: Grasping medium-sized spheres (balls, round shells, sensor spheres).

pose: Thumb opposes multiple semi-flexed fingers, forming a generalized enclosure.
features: High versatility; many contact fingers; adjustable force direction.
usage: Default hand shape for general object grasping.

pose: Thumb opposes the finger array to clamp a thin board edge; other fingers provide lateral support.
features: Linear/narrow surface contact; orthogonal clamping; prevents board flipping.
usage: Grasping and transporting thin boards, cards, or small flat plates.

pose: Thumb presses one arm of the L-shape; other fingers wrap the other arm to lock the corner.
features: Uses internal corner constraints for rotation prevention; differentiated finger flexion for fitting.
usage: Grasping parts with right-angle flanges or L-brackets.

pose: Thumb and middle/ring fingers wrap the handle; index finger extends independently to the trigger.
features: High freedom of movement for the index finger; other fingers provide holding force; thumb provides lateral anti-torsion.
usage: Operating spray guns or trigger-style tools (sprayers, power drills).

pose: Fingers flex dispersedly to adapt to contours; thumb opposes to form an enclosed area.
features: Dispersed fingertip pressure; high adaptability; allows for some gaps.
usage: Grasping irregular and compressible plush toys or soft objects.

pose: Thumb and the side of the index/middle fingers clamp the object's side wall.
features: Contact surface is finger side/pad side; suitable for thin sheets or edge parts.
usage: Grasping edges of thin sheets/cards or pulling out drawer tags.

pose: Thumb and 2-3 fingers wrap around a thick, short handle; high proximal flexion.
features: Long lever arm; torque resistance; thumb presses down to close the grip.
usage: Lifting or rotating pots, pans, or vessels with handles.

pose: Thumb and index tip lightly pinch the edge of a thin sheet; other fingers retracted slightly.
features: Low force; narrow contact line; facilitates quick release.
usage: Picking up single sheets or small amounts of thin paper/receipts.

pose: Thumb, index, and middle fingers form a 3-point clamp on a thin rod; straighter angle.
features: Precise control with distal phalanges; stable support; pinky assists with suspension balance.
usage: Holding writing tools for stable pointing or rotation.

pose: Three fingers clamp a thicker rod; thumb opposes to increase coverage area.
features: Slightly increased inter-finger angle; large contact area; reduces local pressure.
usage: Holding thick pens/markers for writing or pointing.

pose: Distal joint of index finger and thumb pad lightly pinch the edge, then lift.
features: High-precision tip contact; low force output; prevents bending deformation.
usage: Separating and picking up thin sheets/labels/metal flakes from a flat surface.

pose: Thumb and index tip make point contact to pinch needle-like or filamentous objects.
features: Extremely small contact point; high fingertip alignment; requires precise positioning.
usage: Picking up needles, thin rods, or micro-cylindrical components.

pose: Thumb opposes the tips of three fingers to form a stable four-point frame.
features: Multi-point even force distribution; stronger rotation resistance; fingertips enclose a small space.
usage: Fine holding of small objects requiring higher stability.

pose: Fingertips insert into or fit the inner side of the ring; thumb and one finger press against the outside.
features: Forms internal/external opposing pressure; prevents ring detachment; allows for rotation.
usage: Picking up rings, handle loops, or sleeve-like parts.

pose: Thumb and index/middle fingers insert into scissor loops respectively to form fulcrums.
features: Finger flexion/extension drives opening/closing; thumb independently controls one blade.
usage: Operating standard scissors for cutting.

pose: Thumb in the upper loop, middle finger in the lower loop, index finger supports and guides.
features: Separates guidance from driving force; improves cutting stability.
usage: Cutting tasks requiring more precise path control.

pose: Thumb opposes the finger array to embrace the bottle body; index finger extends independently over the pump head.
features: Stable handle; single finger applies pressure; other fingers remain vertical for anti-torsion.
usage: Pressing pump-style shampoo/detergent containers.

pose: Thumb and multiple fingers flex tightly around a small diameter cylinder to form a complete ring.
features: Small distance between fingertips and palm; tight wrapping; high anti-slip force.
usage: Grasping small bottles, short rods, or small tool handles.

pose: Tips of thumb, index, and middle fingers curve to wrap the lower part of a small sphere.
features: Three points form a stable triangle; balanced contact distribution; allows pose fine-tuning.
usage: Grasping tiny spherical objects or spheres requiring top visibility.

pose: Thumb and rear three fingers wrap around the bottle neck; index finger flexes on the trigger.
features: Index finger pulls independently; other fingers provide reaction force; thumb prevents rotation.
usage: Operating spray bottles for spraying.

pose: Fingers insert into the roll's inner edge or wrap the outside; thumb opposes to hold.
features: Combination of internal/external contact; prevents uncontrolled rotation; allows axial extraction.
usage: Picking up and aligning tape rolls for tearing.

pose: Multiple fingers wrap around a straight or slightly elliptical handle; thumb applies pressure to form a stable ring.
features: Proximal flexion; adjustable distal direction; medium-to-high torque resistance.
usage: Grasping hammer handles, screwdrivers, or kitchen tools for use.

pose: Thumb, index, and middle finger pads form a 3-point hold on a thin rod or small part.
features: Triangular support; balance between precision and stability; pinky and ring fingers retracted.
usage: Holding medium-thin pens/rods for pointing or light rotation.

pose: Thumb, index, and middle fingers form a tilted triangle supporting the pen; fingertips near the nib.
features: Fine control; stable support; allows fast micro-adjustment of the nib direction.
usage: Writing, drawing, or continuous trajectory output tasks.
